020package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer;
021
022import static java.lang.Character.charCount;
023import static java.lang.Character.isJavaIdentifierPart;
024import static java.lang.Character.isJavaIdentifierStart;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.UniqueIdUtils.randomUUID;
032
033import javax.lang.model.SourceVersion;
034import java.util.HashMap;
035import java.util.HashSet;
036import java.util.Map;
037import java.util.Set;
038
039import org.apiguardian.api.API;
040import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;
042
043/**
044 *  <p>{@summary Assigns Java identifier names to avoid collisions, 'abuse' of
045 *  keywords, and invalid characters.} To use it, first create an instance of
046 *  this class and allocate all of the names that are needed. Typically this is
047 *  a mix of user-supplied names and constants:</p>
048 *  <pre><code>  NameAllocator nameAllocator = new NameAllocator();
049 *  for( final var property : properties )
050 *  {
051 *      nameAllocator.newName( property.name(), property );
052 *  }
053 *  nameAllocator.newName( "sb", "string builder" );</code></pre>
054 *  <p>Pass a unique tag object to each allocation. The tag scopes the name,
055 *  and can be used to look up the allocated name later. Typically the tag is
056 *  the object that is being named. In the above example we use
057 *  {@code property} for the user-supplied property names, and
058 *  {@code "string builder"} for our constant string builder.</p>
059 *  <p>Once we've allocated names we can use them when generating code:</p>
060 *  <pre><code>  MethodSpec.Builder builder = MethodSpec.methodBuilder( "toString" )
061 *      .addAnnotation( Override.class )
062 *      .addModifiers( Modifier.PUBLIC )
063 *      .returns( String.class );
064 *
065 *  builder.addStatement( "$1T $2N = new $1T()", StringBuilder.class, nameAllocator.get( "string builder" ) );
066 *  for( var property : properties )
067 *  {
068 *      builder.addStatement( "$N.append( $N )", nameAllocator.get( "string builder" ), nameAllocator.get( property ) );
069 *  }
070 *  builder.addStatement( "return $N", nameAllocator.get( "string builder" ) );
071 *  return builder.build();</code></pre>
072 *  <p>The above code generates unique names if presented with conflicts. Given
073 *  user-supplied properties with names {@code ab} and {@code sb} this
074 *  generates the following code:</p>
075 *  <pre><code>  &#64;Override
076 *  public String toString()
077 *  {
078 *    StringBuilder sb_ = new StringBuilder();
079 *    sb_.append( ab );
080 *    sb_.append( sb );
081 *    return sb_.toString();
082 *  }</code></pre>
083 *  <p>The underscore is appended to {@code sb} to avoid conflicting with the
084 *  user-supplied {@code sb} property. Underscores are also prefixed for names
085 *  that start with a digit, and used to replace name-unsafe characters like
086 *  space or dash.</p>
087 *  <p>When dealing with multiple independent inner scopes, use a
088 *  {@link #clone()}
089 *  of the {@code NameAllocator} used for the outer scope to further refine
090 *  name allocation for a specific inner scope.</p>
091 *
092 *  @author Square,Inc.
093 *  @modified   Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
094 *  @version $Id: NameAllocator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
095 *  @since 0.0.5
096 *
097 *  @UMLGraph.link
098 */
099@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: NameAllocator.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
100@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
101public final class NameAllocator implements Cloneable
102{
103        /*------------*\
104    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
105        \*------------*/
106    /**
107     *  The allocated names.
108     */
109    private final Set<String> m_AllocatedNames;
110
111    /**
112     *  The registry for the names.
113     */
114    private final Map<Object,String> m_TagToName;
115
116        /*--------------*\
117    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
118        \*--------------*/
119    /**
120     *  Creates a new {@code NameAllocator} instance.
121     */
122    public NameAllocator() { this( new HashSet<>(), new HashMap<>() ); }
123
124    /**
125     *  Creates a new {@code NameAllocator} instance.
126     *
127     *  @param  allocatedNames  The allocated names.
128     *  @param  tagToName   The registry for names.
129     */
130    @SuppressWarnings( {"CollectionDeclaredAsConcreteClass", "TypeMayBeWeakened"} )
131    private NameAllocator( final HashSet<String> allocatedNames, final HashMap<Object,String> tagToName )
132    {
133        m_AllocatedNames = allocatedNames;
134        m_TagToName = tagToName;
135    }   //  NameAllocator()
136
137        /*---------*\
138    ====** Methods **==========================================================
139        \*---------*/
140    /**
141     *  Translates the given suggestion for an identifier to a valid Java
142     *  identifier by replacing invalid characters by an underscore
143     *  (&quot;_&quot;). If the {@code suggestion} starts with a character that
144     *  is not allowed to start a Java identifier, but is otherwise valid, the
145     *  resulting identifier is prepended by an underscore.
146     *
147     *  @param  suggestion  The suggestion for an identifier.
148     *  @return A valid Java identifier.
149     */
150    public static final String toJavaIdentifier( final String suggestion )
151    {
152        final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
153        var codePoint = requireNotEmptyArgument( suggestion, "suggestion" ).codePointAt( 0 );
154        if( isJavaIdentifierStart( codePoint ) )
155        {
156            buffer.appendCodePoint( codePoint );
157        }
158        else
159        {
160            buffer.append( '_' );
161            if( isJavaIdentifierPart( codePoint ) ) buffer.appendCodePoint( codePoint );
162        }
163        //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
164        for( var i = charCount( codePoint ); i < suggestion.length(); )
165        {
166            codePoint = suggestion.codePointAt( i );
167            buffer.appendCodePoint( isJavaIdentifierPart( codePoint ) ? codePoint : '_' );
168            i += charCount( codePoint );
169        }
170        final var retValue = buffer.toString();
171
172        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
173        return retValue;
174    }   //  toJavaIdentifier()
175
176    /**
177     *  Creates a deep copy of this {@code NameAllocator}. Useful to create
178     *  multiple independent refinements of a {@code NameAllocator} to be used
179     *  in the respective definition of multiples, independently-scoped, inner
180     *  code blocks.
181     *
182     *  @return A deep copy of this NameAllocator.
183     *
184     *  @see Object#clone()
185     */
186    @SuppressWarnings( "MethodDoesntCallSuperMethod" )
187    @Override
188    public final NameAllocator clone()
189    {
190        final var retValue = new NameAllocator( new HashSet<>( m_AllocatedNames ), new HashMap<>( m_TagToName ) );
191
192        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
193        return retValue;
194    }   //  clone()
195
196    /**
197     *  Retrieves a name that was previously created with
198     *  {@link #newName(String, Object)}.
199     *
200     *  @param  tag The identifier for the name.
201     *  @return The name.
202     *  @throws ValidationException  The tag was unknown.
203     */
204    public final String get( final Object tag )
205    {
206        final var retValue = m_TagToName.get( requireNonNullArgument( tag, "tag" ) );
207        if( isNull( retValue ) ) throw new ValidationException( "unknown tag: " + tag );
208
209        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
210        return retValue;
211    }   //  get()
212
213    /**
214     *  Returns a new name using the given suggestion that will not be a Java
215     *  keyword or clash with other names.
216     *
217     *  @param  suggestion  The suggestion.
218     *  @return The new name.
219     */
220    public final String newName( final String suggestion )
221    {
222        return newName( suggestion, randomUUID().toString() );
223    }   //  newName()
224
225    /**
226     *  Returns a new name based on the given suggestion that will not be a
227     *  Java keyword or clash with other names. The returned value can be
228     *  queried multiple times by passing the given tag to
229     *  {@link #get(Object)}.
230     *
231     *  @param  suggestion  The suggestion for the new name.
232     *  @param  tag The tag for the new name.
233     *  @return The new name.
234     */
235    public final String newName( final String suggestion, final Object tag )
236    {
237        requireNonNullArgument( tag, "tag" );
238
239        var retValue = toJavaIdentifier( requireNotEmptyArgument( suggestion, "suggestion" ) );
240
241        while( SourceVersion.isKeyword( retValue ) || !m_AllocatedNames.add( retValue ) )
242        {
243            retValue += "_";
244        }
245
246        final var replaced = m_TagToName.put( tag, retValue );
247        if( nonNull( replaced ) )
248        {
249            m_TagToName.put( tag, replaced ); // Put things back as they were!
250            throw new ValidationException( format( "tag '%s' cannot be used for both '%s' and '%s'", tag, replaced, suggestion ) );
251        }
252
253        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
254        return retValue;
255    }   //  newName()
256}
257//  class NameAllocator
258
259/*
260 *  End of File
261 */
